This same manuscript he afterwards presented to Luigi Marsili (see Sen. xv. 7). In 1338 Dionigi returned to Florence, passing through Avignon on his way. In 1339 he was invited to Naples by King Robert. Both he and King Robert were interested in astrology, a study which Petrarch detested. In G. Villani, x. 86, there is an account of Dionigi’s foretelling the death of Castruccio Castracani.
